title: Does a built-in WiFi mean free internet? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. WiFi is not the same thing as the internet. WiFi is a wireless standard for connecting to a local network. Built-in WiFi means the device has an antenna and is capable of joining a network wirelessly. If the network it joined has an active internet connection, anything on the network, whether wired or wireless, can share the internet connection.

No, Built-in where? The Internet has to come from somewhere like a cable modem connection, just Wifi is not useable at all. That is assuming you have a router and that is connected to a power outlet of course (thanks Ronald)
